issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Create a table with partitions and set the SerDe to be Json. The query "select * from tbl1" works fine.

Now set table level SerDe to be Parquet serde. Based on HIVE-6785, table level and partition level can have different serdes. 

{noformat}

fields.summary: Exception when table-level serde is Parquet while partition-level serde is JSON

comments.body: Add the case to process the case of List. Also added unit tests to cover all the parquet types for mixed partition formats.

{color:red}Overall{color}: -1 at least one tests failed

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12753534/HIVE-11696.patch

Failed cases are not related. [~csun] Can you help review the code? Thanks.
Since we are creating the object as a "ArrayList" in ParquetHiveArrayInspector, seems not necessary to handle ArrayWritable, but should at least handle ArrayList.
